teal.utils 0.0.1
  • Reference

Set the names of a data.frame or vector

named_choices.Rd

Set the names of a data.frame or vector

named_choices(x, xnames)

Arguments

x

either data.frame or character vector
xnames

vector conatining names to be applied to x

Value

a named character vector

Details

If either x or xnames are factors, they are coerced to character. If the names of x and xnames are the same or similar, the unique name is kept. For example if a variable "AGE" should be named "Age" according to xnames, the vector returned will be named just "Age" instead of "AGE: Age". See examples.

This is function is useful to create the vectors passed on to the arguments of the choices_selected arguments in teal modules.

Examples


library(random.cdisc.data)
library(tern)
#> Loading required package: survival
#> Loading required package: grid
#> Loading required package: rtables
#> 
#> This is a beta version for tern v0.5.1. Install the current stable tern v0.5.0 with:
#>   devtools::install_github("Rpackages/tern", "v0.5.0", host = "https://github.roche.com/api/v3")
ADSL <- radsl(N=10, seed = 1)
ADTTE <- radtte(ADSL, seed = 1)

choices1 <- named_choices(ADSL, tern::var_labels(ADSL))
choices2 <- named_choices(ADTTE$PARAMCD, ADTTE$PARAM)

#similar names are not duplicated
choices3 <- named_choices(ADTTE$PARAMCD, ADTTE$PARAMCD)
# NOT RUN {
library(shiny)

shinyApp(
ui = fluidPage(selectInput("c1", label = "Choices from ADSL",
                choices = choices1,
                selected = choices1[1]),

               selectInput("c2", label = "Choices from ADTTE",
                choices = choices2,
                selected = choices2[1])),

server = function(input, output) {}
)

# }
